required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Pneumoperitoneum and Neuromuscular Block on Renal Function in Diabetes Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Pneumoperitoneum Pressure and the Extent of Neuromuscular Block on Renal Function in Patients With Diabetes Undergoing Laparoscopic Pelvic Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: In this single center, double-blind, randomized controlled clinical trial, we will include 648 diabetes patients aged 18-70 undergoing laparoscopic pelvic tumor resection. They will be randomized to the following four groups: high-pressure pneumoperitoneum (10mmHg)+ deep neuromuscular block group, high-pressure pneumoperitoneum (15mmHg)+moderate neuromuscular block group, low-pressure pneumoperitoneum + deep neuromuscular block group and low-pressure pneumoperitoneum+moderate neuromuscular block group. Deep neuromuscular block is defined as post tetanic count (PTC) 1-2, and low neuromuscular block is defined as train-of-four (TOF) twitch 1-2. The outcomes will be indicators for acute kidney injury and surgical condition.

detailed_description.textblock: In this single center, double-blind, randomized controlled clinical trial, we will include 648 diabetes patients aged 18-70 undergoing laparoscopic pelvic tumor resection under general anesthesia. They will be randomized to the following four groups: high-pressure pneumoperitoneum (10mmHg)+ deep neuromuscular block group, high-pressure pneumoperitoneum (15mmHg)+moderate neuromuscular block group, low-pressure pneumoperitoneum + deep neuromuscular block group and low-pressure pneumoperitoneum+moderate neuromuscular block group. Neuromuscular block will be induced by rocuronium bolus and maintained by a continuous infusion of rocuronium. Deep neuromuscular block is defined as PTC 1-2, and low neuromuscular block is defined as train-of-four TOF twitch 1-2. The primary outcome will be serum Cystatin C level, and the secondary outcomes will be serum creatine level, urinary sediment, intraoperative urine output, duration of surgery, surgical space condition and occurrence bucking and body movement.

study_design_info.masking_description: The patients, surgeons and the ones who collect data will be masked.

primary_outcome.description: CysC is a sensitive indicator for early kidney injury, and can be used to estimate glomerular filtration rate (GFR).
CysC is a sensitive indicator for early kidney injury, and can be used to estimate glomerular filtration rate (GFR).
CysC is a sensitive indicator for early kidney injury, and can be used to estimate glomerular filtration rate (GFR).
CysC is a sensitive indicator for early kidney injury, and can be used to estimate glomerular filtration rate (GFR).

secondary_outcome.description: Creatine is also an indicator for kidney injury
Creatine is also an indicator for kidney injury
Creatine is also an indicator for kidney injury
Creatine is also an indicator for kidney injury

secondary_outcome.measure: The volume of intraoperative urine output
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A urine tube will be inserted just before the surgery, so the urine can be drained into a bag. The volume of urine in the bag at the end of the surgery will be the volume of intraoperative urine output.

secondary_outcome.measure: The presence of isomorphic or dysmorphic erythrocyte in urinary sediment
secondary_outcome.description: Erythrocyte in urinary sediment is also an indicator of renal injury.
Duration of surgery is an indicator for procedure difficulty

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The moment when trocars are introduced into pelvic cavity, and then every 15 minutes till the end of surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: We will use Leiden surgical rating scale (Martini et al.) to assess surgical condition. It is a 5-point scale, the minimum and maximum values are 1 and 5, respectively. Higher score indicates better surgical condition.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of bucking and body movement during the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of bucking or body movement is an indicator for the sufficiency of muscle relaxant.
Renal oxygen saturation is an indicator for renal tissue oxygenation.
Cerebral oxygen saturation is an internal reference which can be used to adjust renal tissue oxygen saturation.

arm_group.description: Intra-abdominal pressure will be set to 15 mmHg during the surgery. Deep neuromuscular block will be induced by rocuronium bolus 1 mg/kg, maintained by a continuous infusion of rocuronium (0.6mg/kg/h), and titrated towards post-tetanic count (PTC) 1-2.

Intra-abdominal pressure will be set to 15 mmHg during the surgery. Moderate neuromuscular block will be induced by rocuronium bolus 0.6 mg/kg, maintained by a continuous infusion of rocuronium (0.3mg/kg/h), and titrated towards train-of-four (TOF) twitch 1-2.

Intra-abdominal pressure will be set to 10 mmHg during the surgery. Deep neuromuscular block will be induced by rocuronium bolus 1 mg/kg, maintained by a continuous infusion of rocuronium (0.6mg/kg/h), and titrated towards PTC 1-2.

Intra-abdominal pressure will be set to 10 mmHg. Moderate neuromuscular block will be induced by rocuronium bolus 0.6 mg/kg, maintained by a continuous infusion of rocuronium (0.3mg/kg/h), and titrated towards TOF twitch 1-2.

intervention.description: High-pressure pneumoperitoneum is defined as intra-abdominal pressure 15 mmHg.
Deep neuromuscular block is defined as PTC 1-2.
Low-pressure pneumoperitoneum is defined as intra-abdominal pressure 10 mmHg.
Moderate neuromuscular block is defined as TOF twitch 1-2.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Dean of the Department of Anesthesiology
